title: Simon Sung CV
text:
Computer Science | Mobile Development | Software Development

chengensung1219@gmail.com | My LinkedIn page



I am a BYU-Idaho student, major in computer science, and currently looking for a full time job oportunity for software engineering, mobile development, or the position relate to my major.



Proficient Skills: Swift, SwiftUI, C#, and Python
Developing Skills: Java, C++, Google Script, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Other Skills: Mandarin, Jira, Trello, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
Soft Skills: Problem Solving, Team Work, Adaptive Learning, Time Management, and Communication





January 2023 - December 2023 Brigham Young University - Hawaii

Bachelor Degree in Computer Science

January 2024 - now Brigham Young University - Idaho

Bachelor Degree in Computer Science






March 2024 - April 2025 Brigham Young University - Idaho

Enhanced updating process efficiency from 13+ weeks to 1 day by developing 1 Google Script program with Canvas API application to pull out data and write it to tracker spreadsheet.
Played a key role in team by setting and following up 1 personal learning goals each week to increase coding field knowledge
Promoted open communication with team members and other departments by regularly attending social engagements




March 2025 - September 2025 The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints

Resolved over 100 UI and functional bugs to provide a better user experience for over 100,000 users
Promoted open communication with team members to increase workflow smoothness by asking meaningful questions and sharing observations
Reinvented over 50 accessibility features for VoiceOver users for Gospel Library App
Built a recent image gallery feature for Gospel Library App to allow users to see new images each week







January 2025 - February 2025 Student Personal Academic Project

Founded and launched a mobile weather app for iOS devices to provide users with a nice look, clean, and easy-to-use weather app
Implement OpenWeather API into application to update information according users’ location and time
GitHub Repository




January 2025 - February 2025 Student Personal Academic Project

Develop a snake game Implementing Raylib library to create a functional game with 2 systems (scoring system and trigger system)
Applied 4 principles in object-oriented programming (abstraction, inheritance, polymorphism, and encapsulation) to design efficient and scalable solutions
GitHub Repository
